# The `SystemZHazardRecognizer` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/systemzhazardrecognizer">SystemZHazardRecognizer</a> maintains the state for one MBB during scheduling. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Declaration

<CodeBlock>class llvm::SystemZHazardRecognizer</CodeBlock>

## Description {#details}

### getHazardType() {#a93f9e5c48a726c5f26603735a3e0a08e}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>ScheduleHazardRecognizer::HazardType SystemZHazardRecognizer::getHazardType (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sunit">SUnit</a> &#42;, int Stalls=0)</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
getHazardType - Return the hazard type of emitting this node.

There are three possible results. Either:
<ul>
<li>NoHazard: it is legal to issue this instruction on this cycle.</li>
<li>Hazard: issuing this instruction would stall the machine. If some other instruction is available, issue it first.</li>
<li>NoopHazard: issuing this instruction would break the program. If some other instruction can be issued, do so, otherwise issue a noop.</li>
</ul>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/systemz/systemzhazardrecognizer-h/#l00116">116</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/systemz/systemzhazardrecognizer-h">SystemZHazardRecognizer.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/systemz/systemzhazardrecognizer-cpp/#l00077">77</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/systemz/systemzhazardrecognizer-cpp">SystemZHazardRecognizer.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### groupingCost() {#a0fdaca7e15aaaa6d903d0498220b8cc1}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>int SystemZHazardRecognizer::groupingCost (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sunit">SUnit</a> &#42; SU) const</>}>
Return the cost of decoder grouping for SU.

If SU must start a new decoder group, this is negative if this fits the schedule or positive if it would mean ending a group prematurely. For normal instructions this returns 0.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/systemz/systemzhazardrecognizer-h/#l00137">137</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/systemz/systemzhazardrecognizer-h">SystemZHazardRecognizer.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/systemz/systemzhazardrecognizer-cpp/#l00340">340</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/systemz/systemzhazardrecognizer-cpp">SystemZHazardRecognizer.cpp</a>.

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void SystemZHazardRecognizer::Reset ()"
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Reset - This callback is invoked when a new block of instructions is about to be schedule.

The hazard state should be set to an initialized state.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/systemz/systemzhazardrecognizer-h/#l00117">117</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/systemz/systemzhazardrecognizer-h">SystemZHazardRecognizer.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/systemz/systemzhazardrecognizer-cpp/#l00081">81</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/systemz/systemzhazardrecognizer-cpp">SystemZHazardRecognizer.cpp</a>.

### resourcesCost() {#ab727fc0077d4f6ff1ad7b34cc5d2f069}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>int SystemZHazardRecognizer::resourcesCost (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sunit">SUnit</a> &#42; SU)</>}>
Return the cost of SU in regards to processor resources usage.

A positive value means it would be better to wait with SU, while a negative value means it would be good to schedule SU next.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/systemz/systemzhazardrecognizer-h/#l00142">142</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/systemz/systemzhazardrecognizer-h">SystemZHazardRecognizer.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/systemz/systemzhazardrecognizer-cpp/#l00387">387</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/systemz/systemzhazardrecognizer-cpp">SystemZHazardRecognizer.cpp</a>.

### getCurrCycleIdx() {#ad4e535f0aa753fa6102e686d1fc03d2a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>unsigned SystemZHazardRecognizer::getCurrCycleIdx (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sunit">SUnit</a> &#42; SU=nullptr) const</>}>
Two decoder groups per cycle are formed (for z13), meaning 2x3 instructions.

This function returns a number between 0 and 5, representing the current decoder slot of the current cycle. If an SU is passed which will begin a new decoder group, the returned value is the cycle index of the next group.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/systemz/systemzhazardrecognizer-h/#l00085">85</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/systemz/systemzhazardrecognizer-h">SystemZHazardRecognizer.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/systemz/systemzhazardrecognizer-cpp/#l00061">61</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/systemz/systemzhazardrecognizer-cpp">SystemZHazardRecognizer.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### ProcResourceCounters {#aa26f64ed9c85aded2324baf7a3cf9749}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>SmallVector&lt;int, 0&gt; llvm::SystemZHazardRecognizer::ProcResourceCounters</>}>
The tracking of resources here are quite similar to the common code use of a critical resource.

However, z13 differs in the way that it has two processor sides which may be interesting to model in the future (a work in progress). Counters for the number of uops scheduled per processor resource.
